title: Google\Cloud\Optimization\V1\Shipment\VisitRequest
name: VisitRequest
description:
Request for a visit which can be done by a vehicle: it has a geo-location (or two, see below), opening and closing times represented by time windows, and a service duration time (time spent by the vehicle once it has arrived to pickup or drop off goods).

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.optimization.v1.Shipment.VisitRequest

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.arrival_location
params.description: The geo-location where the vehicle arrives when performing this VisitRequest. If the shipment model has duration distance matrices, arrival_location must not be specified.

params.name: data.arrival_waypoint
params.description: The waypoint where the vehicle arrives when performing this VisitRequest. If the shipment model has duration distance matrices, arrival_waypoint must not be specified.

params.name: data.departure_location
params.description: The geo-location where the vehicle departs after completing this VisitRequest. Can be omitted if it is the same as arrival_location. If the shipment model has duration distance matrices, departure_location must not be specified.

params.name: data.departure_waypoint
params.description: The waypoint where the vehicle departs after completing this VisitRequest. Can be omitted if it is the same as arrival_waypoint. If the shipment model has duration distance matrices, departure_waypoint must not be specified.

params.name: data.tags
params.description: Specifies tags attached to the visit request. Empty or duplicate strings are not allowed.

params.name: data.time_windows
params.description: Time windows which constrain the arrival time at a visit. Note that a vehicle may depart outside of the arrival time window, i.e. arrival time + duration do not need to be inside a time window. This can result in waiting time if the vehicle arrives before [TimeWindow.start_time][google.cloud.optimization.v1.TimeWindow.start_time]. The absence of TimeWindow means that the vehicle can perform this visit at any time. Time windows must be disjoint, i.e. no time window must overlap with or be adjacent to another, and they must be in increasing order. cost_per_hour_after_soft_end_time and soft_end_time can only be set if there is a single time window.

params.name: data.duration
params.description: Duration of the visit, i.e. time spent by the vehicle between arrival and departure (to be added to the possible waiting time; see time_windows).

params.name: data.cost
params.description: Cost to service this visit request on a vehicle route. This can be used to pay different costs for each alternative pickup or delivery of a shipment. This cost must be in the same unit as Shipment.penalty_cost and must not be negative.

params.name: data.load_demands
params.description: Load demands of this visit request. This is just like [Shipment.load_demands][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Shipment.load_demands] field, except that it only applies to this [VisitRequest][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Shipment.VisitRequest] instead of the whole [Shipment][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Shipment]. The demands listed here are added to the demands listed in [Shipment.load_demands][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Shipment.load_demands].

params.name: data.visit_types
params.description: Specifies the types of the visit. This may be used to allocate additional time required for a vehicle to complete this visit (see [Vehicle.extra_visit_duration_for_visit_type][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Vehicle.extra_visit_duration_for_visit_type]). A type can only appear once.

params.name: data.label
params.description: Specifies a label for this VisitRequest. This label is reported in the response as visit_label in the corresponding [ShipmentRoute.Visit][google.cloud.optimization.v1.ShipmentRoute.Visit].

params.name: data.demands
params.description: Deprecated: Use [VisitRequest.load_demands][] instead.

methods.name: getTimeWindows
methods.description:
Time windows which constrain the arrival time at a visit.

Note that a vehicle may depart outside of the arrival time window, i.e. arrival time + duration do not need to be inside a time window. This can result in waiting time if the vehicle arrives before [TimeWindow.start_time][google.cloud.optimization.v1.TimeWindow.start_time]. The absence of TimeWindow means that the vehicle can perform this visit at any time. Time windows must be disjoint, i.e. no time window must overlap with or be adjacent to another, and they must be in increasing order. cost_per_hour_after_soft_end_time and soft_end_time can only be set if there is a single time window.
